intro: Pharnaceum ciliare, commonly known as the slender ciliate pharnaceum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in silky, ciliate hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its specific ecological preferences, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in its native range.
